snippet.title: Trade surplus falls to $856m in June
snippet.content:
RACHEL BAXENDALE
Bill Shorten quotes Malcolm Turnbull's own arguments against a postal plebiscite as a Nationals MP weighs switching to crossbench over the issue.
Peter van Onselen
Irony doesn't get much better: the conservatives who attacked the move to knife Tony Abbott now claim Turnbull must go.
RACHEL BAXENDALE
Peta Credlin reckons Malcolm Turnbull will fail to achieve party unity on same-sex marriage and on the Finkel review.
Rhys Blakely
A prominent US senator says the North Korea threat is in 'a new phase' that the President is prepared to go to war to end.
David Aaronovitch
Those on the far left who portrayed the socialist republic as a beacon now need to be honest about what went wrong.
Adam Sage
About 1000 new arrivals have revived a crisis the French thought they'd dealt with, leaving President Macron floundering.
RICHARD GLUYAS
The Australian Bankers' Association paid a search firm thousands to recruit former Queensland premier Anna Bligh.
NIKI SAVVA
If any MP crossed the floor after being asked by Turnbull not to, the damage to his authority would be extensive.
